reviewText: It's obvious that grandmaster Kwok knows what he's talking about, but I wish he would slow down when demonstrating; if you don't already know the form; you get lost trying to keep up. He had gone through the entire wooden dummy form in about three minutes or less. In dealing with common mistakes; it would have been a perfect time to show the errors and the entire section at a slower pace; not simply correct the error. I like the video, but when a traditional school isn't available and your options to further your training are limited; a little slower pace would be a welcome help.

This DVD is the best instructional on the Ip Man lineage wooden dummy form that I have ever seen.  What sets this one apart from other instructional materials on this subject is the fact that Samuel Kwok breaks down the techniques into practical applications and demonstrates them on one of his students.  Brilliant idea to fully explain not only the form itself, but how to use it in your Wing Chun as well!

Super excited to get the video, It was shrink wrapped and everything but I imagine it has been copied over and over so the copy i got freezes in the middle of a lot of scenes. The content is great however and if you have the patience to sit and wait for the scenes to unfreeze then definitely get it. I am learning the techniques and am not a martial artist and I am picking it up alright

Great video, comprehensive and well done!  Grand Master Kwok is amazing and the techniques are thoroughly taught.  A great tool for learning and review of each section of the wooden dummy, well worth the money invested.
I think the DVD is a good refresher to those who practice the art of Wing Chun. I like the way it is made for this work-out.

very well explained
shown from different angles
as well as fighting applications
very good videos for all levels of training
Easy lessons, but a little skipping on the video.
Good additional training DVD to my traditional hung gar Kung Fu. Tiger/crane Kung Fu.
Absolutely love it and would hope to do business again.
Great instruction. Video is in 2 angles, which works well for learning. Thanks.
I have been doing Wing Chun for many years. I highly  recommend this DVD it's really informative and easy to follow!
Its a very detailed and comprehensive video. If you practice Winn Chun it will help you.
